stacks.name: The Blues Stack
stacks.description: Deployed to the edge (distributed) with a long-running Node.js server and PostgreSQL database. Intended for large and fast production-grade applications serving millions of users.

stacks.name: The Indie Stack
stacks.description: Deployed to a long-running Node.js server with a persistent SQLite database. This stack is great for websites with dynamic data that you control (blogs, marketing, content sites). It's also a perfect, low-complexity bootstrap for MVPs, prototypes, and proof-of-concepts that can later be updated to the Blues stack easily.

stacks.name: The Grunge Stack
stacks.description: Deployed to a serverless function running Node.js with DynamoDB for persistance. Intended for folks who want to deploy a production-grade application on AWS infrastructure serving millions of users.

stacks.name: Speed Metal Stack
stacks.description: The Remix blog stack for deploying to Fly with MDX, SQLite, testing, linting, formatting, etc.

stacks.name: remix-worker-template
stacks.description: All-in-one remix starter template for Cloudflare Workers.

stacks.name: Supa Fly Stack
stacks.description: The Remix stack for deploying to Fly with Supabase, authentication, testing, linting, formatting, etc.

stacks.name: remix-starter-serverless
stacks.description: A template for deploying Remix to AWS with the Serverless framework.

stacks.name: Azure Remix Stack
stacks.description: A Remix stack template for running a Remix app on Azure.

stacks.name: Melodic Death Metal
stacks.description: The Remix Indie Stack without deployment.

stacks.name: Chakra Remix Blues Stack
stacks.description: Chakra UI port for the Remix Blues Stack.

stacks.name: Techno Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for deploying to Kubernetes, talking to an existing Postgres db, authentication, testing, linting, formatting, etc.

stacks.name: K-pop Stack
stacks.description: A template for deploying Remix to Netlify Edge with Supabase

stacks.name: RockSpec Stacks
stacks.description: A template for deploying a Progressive Web App with a persistent database, testing and authentication suites. A fun ride through Remix!

stacks.name: The Bossa Nova Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack with Clerk authentication, Supabase database, Chakra UI, testing, linting, and more.

stacks.name: Chop Suey Stack
stacks.description: A template for deploying Remix to Fly with EdgeDB. Comes with Clerk for simple authentication and opinionated configs for TypeScript, Prettier, and ESLint.

stacks.name: DnB Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for deploying to Vercel with testing, linting, formatting, structure and mock for 3rd party API integration.

stacks.name: Eurodance Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for GraphQL developers, brought by Vulcan.

stacks.name: Indie Thin Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for deploying to Fly or simple Node server with authentication, testing, linting, formatting, etc. Great for integrating with headless CMS
stacks.name: Air Metal Stack
stacks.description: A Remix stack setup to run on Deno with support for Rust WASM modules!

stacks.name: French House Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for Web2 apps and Web3 DApps with authentication with Magic, testing, linting, formatting, etc.

stacks.name: Minimal House Remix Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack to setup Remix with minimal typsescript, tailwind, linting, and formatting. Worry about storage, testing, deployment later.

stacks.name: New Wave Stack
stacks.description: Custom Remix stack using Clerk for authentication and full user management.

stacks.name: Remix Render Stack
stacks.description: A Remix stack for deploying remix to render.com with postgres

stacks.name: Techno Stack
stacks.description: The Remix Stack for deploying to Kubernetes, talking to an existing Postgres Db, authentication, testing, linting, formatting, etc.

stacks.name: Prog Stack
stacks.description: Adapted from blues. Prisma is brilliant, but I like Hasura. Hasura is like prog, it gets better every time you get into it.

stacks.name: Acoustic Stack
stacks.description: A minimal Remix stack to serve as a starting point for demos and debugging.
